cab.content: BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 30th JULY, 1918.1. WESTERN FRONT.(a) Frenoh Front. There is no change in the general situation as reported at noon.Several enemy counter-attacks between SERGY and FERE-EN-TAKDENOIS were repulsed, and a slight advance was made towards SAPONAY (North-west of FERE-EN-TARDBNOIS) which brought in 72 prisoners.Hostile artillery has been active in the area South and West Of SOISSONS.(b) British Front. As a result of the operations by the Australians last night, 1/iERRIS was captured with 140 prisoners. Our casualties are reported to be very light2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS. There is no change.General Staff,War Office, S.W.1, 30th July, 1918.Issued at 6.10 p.m.
